p: In parallel with the above, the use of local wild and feral endemic species is reduced to nearly zero in industrial herbal teas that depend almost exclusively on cultivated or imported materials. However, the examples of Alcea spp. in Lebanon ( Nisrine at al., 2016) and Echium amoenum in Iran ( Latmahalleh et al., 2011) show that cultivation of these formerly wild species is possible, allowing their wider use in commercial preparations.
